author: China Insights
description:
In one week, four places across China erupted in succession: a school track collapsed in Hunan, students went on strike in Jiangsu, an elderly man in Qinhuangdao was detained, and a bank in Guangzhou forced employees to return holiday bonuses. From campuses to banks, from children to the elderly, society is splitting apart. The United Nations projects that by 2100 China’s population could be cut in half—this isn’t a coincidence, it’s a system collapsing.Don’t miss the next drop—subscribe and enable the bell.

With sharp analysis and a touch of dry humor, we dive into the social unrest, economic crises, censorship, faith suppression, and human rights challenges shaping China today.

title: China Unraveling: Sinkholes, Student Revolts, Bank Clawbacks—UN: 1.4B to 600M

author: China Insights
description:
The Fourth Plenary Session has just opened—and Beijing is in turmoil. Hundreds of military vehicles rolled through five provinces overnight; 37 generals were reportedly purged; rumors say Qin Gang is returning. The capital appears to be in a wartime posture: a citywide flight ban, with balloons and sky lanterns prohibited. Signals of a diplomatic “comeback,” a collapse inside the military, and a sweeping lockdown in Beijing—all this looks less like stability maintenance and more like the prelude to a loss of control.Don’t miss the next drop—subscribe and enable the bell.

title: Beijing in Wartime Lockdown: City Sealed, Convoys Roll Across Five Provinces
